options.text: Sviatoslav disregarded comfort, demonstrating an example of severe asceticism.
Sviatoslav hated comfort, showing everyone that he is a poor monk.
The prince didn't like soft beds because he was a very strong man.
Sviatoslav ignored luxury to show how simple his life was.
The destruction of Khazaria paved the way into the steppe for new nomadic tribes.
The defeat of Khazars opened the door for many tourists from the east.
The war with Khazaria made the road very dangerous for the trade.
Sviatoslav destroyed the shield and everyone could go to the forest.
His slogan 'I am coming at you!' became the foundation of the military ethics of Rus'.
His phrase 'I go to you' was the start of the big peace treaty.
He said 'I see you' and then he attacked them very fast.
Sviatoslav's words were the main rule for all the soldiers in Kiev.
The prince sought to create an empire centered in the Balkans.
The prince wanted to build a big house in the middle of the Balkans.
He was looking for a new empire to stay in the center of Europe.
Sviatoslav tried to make a state where Balkans are the main part.
Sviatoslav's death in a Pecheneg ambush marked the end of an entire era.
The fall of the prince in the trap of nomads was the stop of the time.
Sviatoslav died and everyone said that the era is now over.
The Pechenegs killed the prince and it was a very big historical sign.
